sorters.graphics

Class StateArrayPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • sorters.graphics.StateArrayPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class StateArrayPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class models a StateArrayPanel object that will be able to be displayed in a frame and to draw an array encapsuled by a sorter object.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Comparable[] getArray()
      Returns the array displayed in the panel.
      int getCurrent()
      Gets the current element of the panel, i.e. the element that just has been modified in the array.
      int getLast()
      Returns the last element of the array that has been analysed, i.e. the index of the last sorted element in the array.
      long getMillis()
      Returns the time you want to sorting thread to wait between each iteration of the algorithm; 25L is a good one.
      AbstractArraySorter getSorter()
      Returns the sorter displayed in the panel.
      void initSorting()
      Launch the sorting of the array on a separated thread.
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Displays the array on the panel.
      void setArray(java.lang.Comparable[] array)
      Sets the array displayed in the panel.
      void setCurrent(int i)
      Sets the current element of the panel, i.e. the element that just has been modified in the array.
      void setLast(int i)
      Sets the last element of the array that has been analysed, i.e. the index of the last sorted element in the array.
      void setMillis(long millis)
      Sets the time you want to sorting thread to wait between each iteration of the algorithm; 25L is a good one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateArrayPanel

        public StateArrayPanel(AbstractArraySorter sorter,
               long millis,
               boolean toolbar)
        Creates a new instance of StateArrayPanel that will draw an array.
        Parameters:
        sorter - the sorter you will display on the panel.
        millis - the time you want to sorting thread to wait between each iteration of the algorithm; 25L is a good one.
        toolbar - if you want to display a simple toolbar with a start button wich can start the sorting algorithms.
